p: In theory, SARS-CoV‑2 could be completely eradicated by strict isolation of all infectious sources similar to the extinction of a predator in the absence of prey. However, in practice such an approach seems unfeasible given (1) the extent of the virus’s spread and the huge socioeconomic impact of global containment measures and (2) the required intense and persevering surveillance using virological tests that can identify all virus shedders, including individuals with an asymptomatic SARS-CoV‑2 infection.
